pn = function(c,d){
    cc = c[c!=0]
    dd = d[c!=0]
    p = paste0("{",cc,"}x^{",dd,"}",collapse="+")
    p = gsub("x^{0}","",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("x^{1}","x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("+{-","-{",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("+{1}x","+x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("-{1}x","-x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("{-1}x","-x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("{1}x","x",p,fixed=T)
    return(p)
}

Question
========

Find all solutions to the equation below:

$$`r eq1`$$


Answerlist
-------

`r al`


Solution
========

Undo the squaring on both sides. Notice that $\sqrt{\frac{`r wid^2`}{4}}=\frac{\sqrt{`r wid^2`}}{\sqrt{4}}=\frac{`r wid`}{2}$. Also, remember that when you undo the squaring function, we need to consider multiple possibilities because the squaring function is NOT one-to-one.

$$`r eq2`$$

`r wrd1` $\frac{`r abs(2*mid)`}{2}$ `r wrd2` both sides of the equation.

$$`r eq3`$$

We are adding/subtracting fractions, and the fractions have a common denominator, so we can simply add/subtract the numerators.

$$`r eq4`$$

Evaluate both solutions.

$$x=`r x1`~~~~~\text{or}~~~~x=`r x2`$$
